item.title: New Minor in Quantum Computing Now Available
item.description: A new interdisciplinary minor is available for any student who wants to explore quantum computing. Students will gain both theoretical insight and practical exposure to quantum algorithms, hardware platforms, and the concept of quantum advantage, the point at which quantum systems outperform classical approaches on meaningful tasks. Minor requirements can be found in the RPI catalog. To discuss declaring this minor, please contact the School of Science Hub at ScienceHub@rpi.edu

item.description: Join us via Microsoft Teams on Monday, October 27, from 4:00–5:00 PM (ET) for an Information Session on the Track-4: Accelerate Quantum Computing Research (2026 Projects) RFP. The Future of Computing Research Center (FCRC)—a partnership between RPI and IBM—advances innovation in AI algorithms, hardware-software co-design, semiconductor technologies, and quantum computing. This session will outline research topics of interest, the proposal template, and submission timelines for Track-4 projects,…

item.title: Computer Science Colloquia: Justin Hsu - From Discrete to Continuous: Programming Languages for Time and Space | Oct. 27
item.description: Date: Monday, October 27, 2025 4:00 PM - 5:00 PM - Justin Hsu is an associate professor of Computer Science at Cornell University. His research focuses on formal verification of probabilistic programs and quantitative programs. His work has been recognized by the EATCS Presburger Award, a Royal Society Wolfson Visiting Fellowship, a NSF CAREER award, a SIGPLAN John C. Reynolds Doctoral Dissertation award, distinguished paper awards from POPL and CAV, and industrial awards from Facebook.

item.title: Neil Rolnick Performs: SoloS | Oct. 24
item.description: Composer and electronic music pioneer Neil Rolnick will perform SoloS, a program of works for solo laptop that spans his career from the late 1970s to the present. The performance includes a range of works from early pieces for digital sampler to his multimedia collaboration with experimental filmmaker Barbara Hammer. Join us October 24 at 7pm at the RPI Chapel and Cultural Center.

item.title: HASS Family Weekend Music Showcase on Saturday October 25
item.description: This program features the RPI Orchestra, Concert Choir, and Wind Symphony in a musical preview of works that will be included on the Dec. 6th RPI Holiday Concert, including Mark Camphouse’s “A Movement for Rosa”, Christopher Tin’s “Baba Yetu”, and Bedrich Smetana’s “Die Moldau”. Admission is free. Showcase starts at 2:30pm in DCC 308.
